definition: first of the ten Heavenly Stems 十天干[shi2 tian1 gan1]/(used for an unspecified person or thing)/first (in a list, as a party to a contract etc)/letter "A" or roman "I" in list "A, B, C", or "I, II, III" etc/armor plating/shell or carapace/(of the fingers or toes) nail/bladed leather or metal armor (old)/ranking system used in the Imperial examinations (old)/civil administration unit in the baojia 保甲[bao3 jia3] system (old)/ancient Chinese compass point: 75°
lower form of animal life, including insects, insect larvae, worms and similar creatures/CL:條|条[tiao2],隻|只[zhi1]/(fig.) person with a particular undesirable characteristic

sentences.english: Earwig is a kind of beetle.
sentences.chinese: 地蜈蚣是甲殼蟲的一種。

sentences.english: For example, scarabs in the form of the beetle insect were believed to be the symbol of new life.
sentences.chinese: 例如，甲殼蟲外形的聖甲蟲被認爲是新生的象徵。

sentences.english: I got this Beatles CD in the second-hand shop for a pound.
sentences.chinese: 這張甲殼蟲樂隊的CD在二手店才賣一英鎊。

sentences.english: Another homage to music legends - this time the Beatles.
sentences.chinese: 這幅壁畫是獻給甲殼蟲樂隊的傳奇音樂人的。

sentences.english: Smetimes a beetle lost its way in the passages.
sentences.chinese: 有一次，一隻甲殼蟲在通道里迷了路。

sentences.english: It was from the four-member British group the Beatles.
sentences.chinese: 由英國四人樂團甲殼蟲演唱。

sentences.english: Room, you'd say, for a silver coin or a beetle bug.
sentences.chinese: 你會說，這是用來裝銀幣或者甲殼蟲的。

sentences.english: It is a scarab, a type which comprises 10 per cent of all beetles.
sentences.chinese: 這是一種包括10%各種甲殼蟲在內的聖甲蟲。

sentences.english: Let's talk about manias. Let's start with Beatle mania.
sentences.chinese: 讓我們來談談狂熱，先從甲殼蟲熱說起。

sentences.english: The Beatles were the best-known pop group at that time.
sentences.chinese: 甲殼蟲樂隊在當時是最聞名的樂隊。

sentences.english: It was Fraser who suggested me as a designer for the Beatles' new album.
sentences.chinese: 是弗雷澤推薦了我設計甲殼蟲的新專輯。

sentences.english: Because she allways says when her car gets too old she will buy a beetle.
sentences.chinese: 因爲她總是說當她的車變舊時，她將買個甲殼蟲。

sentences.english: He smashed the headlights and taillights.
sentences.chinese: 他又砸碎了甲殼蟲的前燈和尾燈。

sentences.english: Looing the bus run as beetles, and what is your feeling?
sentences.chinese: 看那汽車像甲殼蟲那樣行走時，你有什麼感想？

sentences.english: 1964 - The Beatles arrive on their first visit to the United States.
sentences.chinese: 1964年的今天，甲殼蟲樂隊首次抵達美國。

sentences.english: The Beatles’“1” is America’s best-selling album so far this century, according to Nielsen SoundScan.
sentences.chinese: 甲殼蟲樂隊的“1”是本世紀美國銷量最好的唱片。

definition: (idiom) to have one's words turn out to be (tragically) prophetic
white face/face painting in Beijing opera etc
